Color.description: RGBA color as [r, g, b] or [r, g, b, a], values 0-255. Alpha defaults to 255 if omitted.

KeyCode.description: Key identifier - integer constant (KEY_*), symbol (:space, :a, :left, etc.), or array of keys to check any match

MouseButton.description: Mouse button identifier - integer constant (MOUSE_*) or symbol

clear.description: Clear the screen with a solid color

draw_rect_rotated.signature: draw_rect_rotated(x, y, w, h, angle, color)
draw_rect_rotated.description: Draw a filled rectangle rotated around its center

draw_line.description: Draw a line between two points

draw_line_thick.signature: draw_line_thick(x1, y1, x2, y2, thickness, color)
draw_line_thick.description: Draw a thick line between two points

draw_circle_gradient.description: Draw a circle with a radial gradient from inner to outer color

draw_triangle.signature: draw_triangle(x1, y1, x2, y2, x3, y3, color)

draw_triangle_outline.signature: draw_triangle_outline(x1, y1, x2, y2, x3, y3, color)

measure_text.description: A loaded image texture for drawing sprites and images

point_in_rect?.signature: point_in_rect?(arg1, arg2, arg3, arg4, arg5, arg6)

rect_overlap?.signature: rect_overlap?(arg1, arg2, arg3, arg4, arg5, arg6, arg7, arg8)

rect_contains?.signature: rect_contains?(arg1, arg2, arg3, arg4, arg5, arg6, arg7, arg8)

circle_overlap?.signature: circle_overlap?(arg1, arg2, arg3, arg4, arg5, arg6)

circle_rect_overlap?.signature: circle_rect_overlap?(arg1, arg2, arg3, arg4, arg5, arg6, arg7)

initialize.description: Create a new Camera2D with optional initial values.

params.name: target
params.description: World position the camera looks at (default: 0,0)

params.name: offset
params.description: Screen position offset, typically screen center (default: 0,0)

initialize.example: cam = Camera2D.new(offset: Vec2.new(400, 300))  # Center on 800x600 screen

target.description: Get the world position the camera is looking at.

offset.description: Get the screen position offset (where the target appears on screen). Typically set to screen center for centered camera following.

zoom.description: Get the zoom level. 1.0 = normal, 2.0 = 2x magnification, 0.5 = zoomed out.

rotation.description: Get the camera rotation in degrees.

target=.description: Set the world position the camera looks at.

offset=.description: Set the screen position offset. The target appears at this screen position. Set to screen center for centered following.

zoom=.description: Set the zoom level. 1.0 = normal, 2.0 = 2x magnification, 0.5 = zoomed out.
zoom=.example: camera.zoom = 0.5    # Zoom out (see more of the world)

rotation=.description: Set the camera rotation in degrees.

follow.description: Configure the camera to follow a target object with optional smoothing and deadzone. The target must respond to `position` (returning Vec2) or have `x`/`y` methods. Call with nil to stop following.

params.name: target
params.description: Object with position/x/y to follow, or nil to stop

params.name: deadzone
params.description: Rectangle where target can move without camera moving

bounds=.description: Set camera bounds to constrain movement within a world region. The camera will not show areas outside these bounds. Set to nil to remove bounds.

params.name: value
params.description: The world bounds, or nil to remove

bounds.description: Get the current camera bounds. Returns nil if no bounds are set.

returns.description: The world bounds, or nil if unbounded

shake.description: Trigger a screen shake effect. The shake decays over the duration.

params.name: duration
params.description: How long the shake lasts in seconds (default: 0.3)

world_to_screen.description: Convert a world position to screen coordinates. Useful for placing UI elements relative to game objects.

screen_to_world.description: Convert a screen position to world coordinates. Useful for mouse picking and click-to-move.

use.description: Execute a block with this camera's transform applied. All drawing within the block will be transformed by the camera (position, zoom, rotation). The camera mode is automatically ended when the block completes.

returns.description: The return value of the block

use.example:
# Nested cameras
  world_camera.use do
    draw_world()
  end
  # UI drawn outside camera (screen space)
  draw_ui()

current=.description: Set the current active camera (class method). This camera will be used for sprite rendering and coordinate transformations.

params.name: value
params.description: The camera to make current, or nil to clear

current.description: Get the current active camera (class method). Returns nil if no camera is set.

load.description: Load a texture from a file. Supports PNG, JPG, BMP, and other common formats.

params.name: path
params.description: Path to the image file (relative to game root)

raises: RuntimeError if the file cannot be loaded

width.description: Get the texture width in pixels

height.description: Get the texture height in pixels

draw.description: Draw the texture at a position, optionally with a color tint

draw_ex.description: Draw the texture with rotation and scaling

draw_pro.description: A tile-based map for efficient rendering of large worlds using a tileset texture

new.description: Create a new tilemap with the specified dimensions. All tiles are initialized to -1 (empty/transparent).

params.name: tileset
params.description: The tileset texture containing all tile graphics

params.name: tile_width
params.description: Width of each tile in pixels

params.name: tile_height
params.description: Height of each tile in pixels

raises: ArgumentError if dimensions are not positive

draw_region.signature: draw_region(arg1, arg2, arg3, arg4, arg5, arg6, [arg7])

initialize.description: Create a new Vec2 with optional x and y values.

+.description: Add two vectors, returning a new Vec2.

returns.description: A new vector with the sum

-.description: Subtract two vectors, returning a new Vec2.

returns.description: A new vector with the difference

*.description: Multiply vector by a scalar, returning a new Vec2.

/.description: Divide vector by a scalar, returning a new Vec2.

params.name: scalar
params.description: The scalar value (must not be zero)

to_s.description: A 3D vector with x, y, and z components. Used for 3D positions, colors (RGB), and other 3-component values. Supports arithmetic operations.

initialize.description: Create a new Vec3 with optional x, y, and z values.

+.description: Add two vectors, returning a new Vec3.

returns.description: A new vector with the sum

-.description: Subtract two vectors, returning a new Vec3.

returns.description: A new vector with the difference

*.description: Multiply vector by a scalar, returning a new Vec3.

/.description: Divide vector by a scalar, returning a new Vec3.

params.name: scalar
params.description: The scalar value (must not be zero)

to_s.description: A rectangle with position (x, y) and dimensions (w, h). Used for bounds, source rectangles, collision areas, and UI layout.

initialize.description: Create a new Rect with optional position and dimensions.

returns.description: String in format "Rect(x, y, w, h)"

initialize.description: Create a new Node with default transform.

add_child.description: Add a child node. Removes from previous parent if any. Cycle detection prevents a node from becoming its own ancestor.

params.name: child
params.description: The node to add as a child

remove_child.description: Remove a child node. The child becomes a root node.

parent.description: Get the parent node, or nil if this is a root.
parent.example: if node.parent then puts "has parent" end

children.description: Get an array of child nodes.

local_position.description: Get the local position relative to parent.

local_rotation.description: Get the local rotation in degrees.

local_position=.description: Set the local position relative to parent.

local_rotation=.description: Set the local rotation in degrees.

world_position.description: Get the world position after hierarchy composition. Call Node.update_world_transforms(root) first to ensure accuracy.

world_rotation.description: Get the world rotation in degrees after hierarchy composition.

world_scale.description: Get the world scale after hierarchy composition.

active.description: Get the active flag of this node (ignores parent state).

returns.description: true if this node is active

active=.description: Set the active flag of this node.

params.name: value
params.description: true to activate, false to deactivate

active?.description: Check if this node is active in the full hierarchy. Returns false if this node or any ancestor is inactive.

Node.update_world_transforms.description: Update world transforms for a node and all descendants. Call this on the root before reading world_position/rotation/scale.

params.name: root
params.description: The root node to start from

init.description: Called once when the scene becomes active. Override to initialize scene state.

update.description: Called every frame while this scene is on top of the stack. Override to update game logic.

params.name: dt
params.description: Delta time in seconds since last frame

draw.description: Called every frame while this scene is on top of the stack. Override to draw scene content.

unload.description: Stack-based scene lifecycle manager. Use load to switch scenes (clears stack), push to add a scene on top, and pop to return to the previous scene.

load.description: Clear the scene stack and load a new scene. Calls unload on all existing scenes (top to bottom), then init on the new scene.

register.description: Alias for load. Clear the scene stack and load a new scene.

push.description: Push a new scene onto the stack. The current scene is paused (no longer receives update/draw). Calls init on the new scene.

pop.description: Remove the top scene from the stack. Calls unload on the removed scene. The previous scene resumes receiving update/draw calls.

update.description: Call update on the top scene. Call this from your game's update function.

draw.description: Call draw on the top scene. Call this from your game's draw function.

add_overlay.description: Add an overlay scene that renders on top of the main scene. Overlays receive update and draw calls. Multiple overlays can be active.

has_overlay?.description: Check if an overlay is currently active.

returns.description: true if the overlay is active

initialize.description: Create a new Sprite from a texture with optional initial values.

params.name: texture
params.description: The texture to use for this sprite

params.name: z
params.description: Explicit z-index for layering (default: nil, uses draw order)

params.name: source_rect
params.description: Region of texture to draw (default: entire texture)

x.description: Get the X position of the sprite.

y.description: Get the Y position of the sprite.

x=.description: Set the X position of the sprite.

y=.description: Set the Y position of the sprite.

position.description: Get the position as a Vec2.

position=.description: Set the position using a Vec2.

rotation=.description: Set the rotation in degrees. Positive values rotate clockwise.

params.name: value
params.description: The new rotation angle in degrees

rotation=.example: sprite.rotation += 90 * dt  # Rotate 90 degrees per second

scale_x=.description: Set the X scale factor. Values greater than 1 stretch, less than 1 shrink.

params.name: value
params.description: The new X scale (1.0 = normal size)

scale_y=.description: Set the Y scale factor. Values greater than 1 stretch, less than 1 shrink.

params.name: value
params.description: The new Y scale (1.0 = normal size)

origin_x.description: Get the X origin (pivot point) for rotation and scaling.

returns.description: The X origin offset in pixels

origin_y.description: Get the Y origin (pivot point) for rotation and scaling.

returns.description: The Y origin offset in pixels

origin_x=.description: Set the X origin (pivot point) for rotation and scaling.

params.name: value
params.description: The X origin offset in pixels

origin_y=.description: Set the Y origin (pivot point) for rotation and scaling.

params.name: value
params.description: The Y origin offset in pixels

origin.description: Get the origin (pivot point) as a Vec2.

origin=.description: Set the origin (pivot point) using a Vec2.

center_origin.description: Set the origin to the center of the sprite, so it rotates and scales around its center. Uses texture dimensions or source_rect if set.

z.description: Get the explicit z-index for layering. Returns nil if using automatic draw order (the default). Higher z values render on top of lower values.

returns.description: The z-index, or nil if using draw order

z.example:
if sprite.z.nil?
  puts "Using automatic draw order"
end

z=.description: Set an explicit z-index for layering, or nil to use draw order. By default (nil), sprites are layered by draw order - later drawn sprites appear on top. Setting an explicit z gives you precise control over layering.

params.name: value
params.description: The z-index (higher = on top), or nil for draw order

color.description: Get the color tint as an RGBA array. White [255,255,255,255] means no tint.

returns.description: RGBA color array [r, g, b, a]

color=.description: Set the color tint as an RGBA array. The sprite is multiplied by this color.

params.name: value
params.description: RGBA color array [r, g, b] or [r, g, b, a]

alpha.description: Get the alpha (opacity) as a float from 0.0 (invisible) to 1.0 (opaque).

flip_x.description: Check if the sprite is flipped horizontally.

flip_y.description: Check if the sprite is flipped vertically.
flip_y.example:
if sprite.flip_y
  puts "Flipped upside down"
end

flip_x=.description: Set whether the sprite is flipped horizontally. Useful for facing direction.

flip_y=.description: Set whether the sprite is flipped vertically.

source_rect.description: Get the source rectangle (region of texture to draw). Returns nil if using the entire texture.

returns.description: The source rectangle, or nil if using full texture

source_rect=.description: Set the source rectangle to draw only part of the texture. Useful for sprite sheets and animations. Set to nil to draw the full texture.

params.name: value
params.description: The source rectangle, or nil for full texture

width.description: Get the width of the sprite (from source_rect or texture).

height.description: Get the height of the sprite (from source_rect or texture).

parent.description: Get the parent Transform2D. Returns nil if no parent is set.

returns.description: The parent transform, or nil if none

parent=.description: Set a Transform2D as the parent. The sprite will transform relative to the parent's world transform. Set to nil to remove the parent.

params.name: value
params.description: The parent transform, or nil to clear

parent=.example:
# Sprite follows a transform
  turret_base = Transform2D.new(x: 200, y: 200)

draw.description: Queue the sprite for rendering. Sprites are drawn in z-order after all draw() calls complete. By default, draw order determines layering (later = on top). Set sprite.z to override with an explicit z-index.

count.description: Get the total number of active sprites (class method).

initialize.description: Create a new Transform2D with optional initial values.

x.description: Get the X position of the transform.

y.description: Get the Y position of the transform.

position.description: Get the position as a Vec2.

origin_x.description: Get the X origin (pivot point) for rotation and scaling.

returns.description: The X origin offset in pixels

origin_y.description: Get the Y origin (pivot point) for rotation and scaling.

returns.description: The Y origin offset in pixels

x=.description: Set the X position of the transform.

y=.description: Set the Y position of the transform.

position=.description: Set the position using a Vec2.

rotation=.description: Set the rotation in degrees. Positive values rotate clockwise.

params.name: value
params.description: The new rotation angle in degrees

rotation=.example: transform.rotation += 90 * dt  # Rotate 90 degrees per second

scale_x=.description: Set the X scale factor. Values greater than 1 stretch horizontally, less than 1 shrink. Negative values flip horizontally.

params.name: value
params.description: The new X scale (1.0 = normal size)

scale_y=.description: Set the Y scale factor. Values greater than 1 stretch vertically, less than 1 shrink. Negative values flip vertically.

params.name: value
params.description: The new Y scale (1.0 = normal size)

origin_x=.description: Set the X origin (pivot point) for rotation and scaling. The origin is the point around which the transform rotates and scales.

params.name: value
params.description: The X origin offset in pixels from top-left

origin_y=.description: Set the Y origin (pivot point) for rotation and scaling. The origin is the point around which the transform rotates and scales.

params.name: value
params.description: The Y origin offset in pixels from top-left

parent.description: Get the parent transform. Returns nil if no parent is set. When a transform has a parent, its position, rotation, and scale are relative to the parent's world transform.

returns.description: The parent transform, or nil if none

parent.example:
if transform.parent
  puts "Has a parent!"
end

parent=.description: Set the parent transform for hierarchical transformations. When parented, this transform's position, rotation, and scale become relative to the parent. Set to nil to remove the parent.

params.name: value
params.description: The parent transform, or nil to clear

world_position.description: Get the final world position after applying all parent transforms. For transforms without a parent, this equals the local position. For parented transforms, this returns the actual screen position after parent transformations.

returns.description: The world position after parent hierarchy composition

world_position.example:
# Get world position of a child transform
  parent = Transform2D.new(x: 100, y: 100)
  parent.rotation = 90
  child = Transform2D.new(x: 50, y: 0)
  child.parent = parent
  pos = child.world_position  # Position after rotation by parent
